## Burns Bog Ecological Conservancy Area

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column}

Protects a raised ombrotrophic peat bog in Delta, BC.

* 50+ years of peat harvesting & development
  * **BBECA** established in 2004
* Restoration practices include:
  * Ditch blocking
  * Seedling removal  

:::

::: {.column}

## Climatology

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

The bog has a mean annual air temperature of 10.5 C and averages 1130 mm of precipitation a year.

* Mediterranean climate poses management challenges
  * Summer: heatwaves, droughts, & fires 
  * Winter: Intense precipitation & flooding

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

![](images/Climatology.png)


:::

# Flux Measurement Sites

![](images/BB1_System.jpg)


## BB1

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

Beakrush-sphagnum ecosystem undergoing active restoration. 

* Harvested from 1957 to 1963
  * Ditch-blocking began in 2007
  * EC station established in 2015
* Net-neutral C fluxes between 2016 and 2021 [@satriawan_interannual_2022]
  * CO<sub>2</sub> uptake offset by CH<sub>4</sub> emissions

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}


![](images/BB1_System.jpg)


:::
::::


## BB2

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

Beakrush-sphagnum/pine-sphagnum ecosystem passively rewetting. 

* Harvested from 1930 to 1948
  * EC station established in 2019
* Net C source in 2020 [@nyberg_impacts_2021]
  * Net CO<sub>2</sub> & CH<sub>4</sub> emission

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

![](images/BB2_System.jpg){fig-align="center" height=550} 

:::
::::

## GHG fluxes from Prairie Pothole wetlands 

In collaboration with Ducks Unlimited Canada, we are measuring GHG fluxes from wetlands in the Prairie Pothole region of Canada (Manitoba).

::: {layout-ncol=2}

![](images/Hogg.png)

![](images/Young.png)

:::

## GHG fluxes from Prairie Pothole wetlands 

Despite both looking like typical marshes, they have VERY different $CH_{4}$ fluxes driven by differences in sulfate between the sites. This could be an interesting case study for CLASSIC.

::: {layout-ncol=2}

![](images/FCH4.png)

![](images/NEE.png)

:::
